page.title: 17Blenkinsopp Hall
page.content: To the west of Haltwhistle, set among stately, mature trees, stands Blenkinsopp Hall, a large country house, home of the Joicey family. Both entrances are guarded by lodges and a mile long drive leads to the Hall. It has battlements, a courtyard, stable block and laundry rooms. The late Major Joicey's mother was Violet Lorraine, a famous actress of the London Stage. The Major's widow lives alone in half of the Hall but is regularly visited by her three daughters and their families. Bungalows which used to house estate workers now provide homes for people who work in Haltwhistle. An estate manager looks after the farms and property on the estate. A gardener is employed and each year the gardens are opened to the public to raise money for charity.
